intro: Plagiobothrys californicus var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender California sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland areas. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom from late spring to early summer. The species is part of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
